pires more thought in this department. My solution here was dynamic

s (or static if one prefers). So with a simple "with Basics" you can

izing the output. I decided to put that

y, the run method just returns a list of

he BriefReport calls the one by one and

the running and the reporting is nicely
> separated and which testing style=
 you choose has no bearing on the output

be paired with a verbose method if one
> wishes more verbose output.
>
> No=
w came the color/no color issue. Color feels like an aspect of reporting.

 This might be a case of golden hammer but to represent this aspect as a
> =
stackable trait felt quite nice. Especially when creating instances of a

direction: new Brief with Color with Summary with SourceDump with

aceFiltering with LongRunningTestTopList ExecutionTimeStatistics ...

e only problem (ok there are several probably by the obvious problem

he package object in the poju4s package that allows me to write brief(spec)=

f(spec.select('example1, 'example2))

:

tion:

g,

tering >>: Color >>:

ailed. That is a missing part from my output, just effectively

 some feedback that they were actually run. I intend to address

ou suggested, list the failing pending and ignored tests in the

hat allows one to poke around a bit more in the result (after all it

 REPL so why shouldn't one be able to interact with the result?).

s of what one could do "post"-running is to dump captured std-out,

tering, grouping and mapping to the users desire. Why not conveniently

low rerun just failed tests in this way?

these things need to be isolated to just

original idea is much less interesting then

nd reporting from the REPL in general. For now

tilled into a more framework agnostic run/report

nsible thing is to just leave the ideas out there

ease... I'm not sure what is best yet but the

he REPL...
